desc: The system of how money is made and used within a country or region.
example: The global economy is recovering after the crisis.

desc: A place or system where goods and services are bought and sold.
example: They introduced a new product to the market.

desc: The management of money, especially by governments or large organizations.
The act of putting money into something to earn a profit.
example: They made a large investment in real estate.

desc: The money a business earns after expenses.
example: The company made a huge profit last quarter.

desc: When a business spends more money than it earns.
example: They suffered a financial loss during the pandemic.

desc: Money that people and businesses must pay to the government.
example: The government raised the income tax rate.

desc: A plan for how money will be earned and spent.
example: We need to stay within our monthly budget.

desc: A financial institution where people keep and borrow money.
example: She opened a savings account at the local bank.

desc: A record of money kept in a bank or financial organization.
example: He transferred money to his checking account.
